data: PED BIOCHEM Propionic Acidemia (PA) Post Liver Transplant (Module)
q4h, heart rate, blood pressure, respiratory rate, temperature
q2h, heart rate, blood pressure, respiratory rate, temperature
q1h, heart rate, blood pressure, respiratory rate, temperature
q12h, heart rate, blood pressure, respiratory rate, temperature
If the patient tolerates feeds and no vomiting and ammonia less than 60 umol/L and no / mild acidosis start sick day formula via NG-Tube
PLACEHOLDER: Natural protein should be reintroduced stepwise over the next 24-48 hours according to sick day formula recipes

If patient dose not tolerate feeds, is vomiting / has diarrhea and / or if there is a decreased level of consciousness and /or severe acidosis and / or if ammonia is greater than 90 umol/L start IV D10NS to a total volume of 1.5 x maintenance for 2-3 hours and start intralipid 20%
1000 + 50 mL/kg for each kg above 10 kg
1500 + 20 mL/kg for each kg above 20 kg
PLACEHOLDER: KCL 20 mmol to D10NS after patient voids
PLACEHOLDER: levOCARNitine 100 mg/kg given in 2 doses.  Is this daily or BID, does it stop?  IV 100-200 divided into 4 doses, so q6h and is for 4 doses only
50 mg/kg, PO, BID, order duration: 2 doses or times, drug form: oral liq
50 mg/kg, NG-tube, BID, order duration: 2 doses or times, drug form: oral liq
25 mg/kg, IV, q6h, order duration: 4 doses or times, drug form: inj
50 mg/kg, IV, q6h, order duration: 4 doses or times, drug form: inj

PLACEHOLDER: If ammonia greater than 200 start carbamoyl-glutamic acid loading dose 100 mg/kg PO/NG-Tube followed by 50 ,g/kg PO divided q6h.  Adjust dose according to ammonia levels.  This was in the regular PA PPO, is it applicable here?
